lines.text:
[Opening title]
Before the most ancient civilization arose, before the first city in the world was built, before man trod the earth - then, as now, there stretched across vast spaces of farther Asia a great green threatening mass of vegetation... the Jungle...
Man, the intruder, came into the Jungle... He fought it... He never vanquished it... For strong is the Jungle.
Time and time again fields, towns, great Empires were hacked out of the Jungle... They are forgotten... Always the Jungle rose in its wealth and swallowed them.
But Man must live... So Man fights on.
Give Bimbo a bite, big boy!
WOOF! WOOF!
BAA-AA-AA! BAA-AA-AA!
WOOF! WOOF! WOOF! WOOF!
BAA-AA-AA!
WOOF! WOOF! WOOF! WOOF!
BAA-AA-AA! BA-A-A-! BAA-AA-A!
WOOF! WOOF!
O Buddha, protect our crop!
Tigers like dog-meat, and like it young and tender.
While Man sleeps, the Jungle wakes.
Drive them out, brothers! Drive them, O brave men, O strong men!
We be mighty hunters, Kru!
lines.character: A Friend from the Lao Village

lines.text: Even so, Tahn. Every tiger in the Jungle will tremble at our names!
To protect his rice against the evil spirits of the Jungle - a mantra, a secret, strange witch charm.
Come quick! A Chang!
Give him hell, boys!
Take him away... I don't like his nose!
All is well now - praised be the Lord Buddha!
Wait for Bimbo!
The Great Herd near here? What foolish words be these, O grandson of a monkey?
Lies!... A tale with which to frighten women and little children!

Fire. The friend of man. The dreaded enemy of every Jungle beast... Night after night the great bonfires blaze up with scarlet tongues, stretching an ever-tightening wall of flame around the Great Herd.
OUT, SWORDS! OUT, SPEARS! OUT, O BRAVE MEN! HELP US, O LORD BUDDHA!
Strong is the elephant; stronger is Man's mind. Here, as everywhere, brawn surrenders to brain.
Never completely victorious... Never completely defeated... Such is Man's fate in the Jungle... So he fights on...
